caption: b'Beyond reducing our greenhouse gas emissions, there is enormous potential to remove gases from the atmosphere by harnessing nature\xe2\x80\x99s own solutions. b"For #FlashbackFriday, we're highlighting the long history of @nescafe, our iconic coffee brand. b'Snack bar perfection? Introducing our new range of YES! Plant Protein bars that are good for you and for the environment.
.

.

b"We're investing CHF2.5 million to protect and restore the Cavally forest in C\xc3\xb4te d'Ivoire, as part of our broader efforts to tackle climate change.
.
The Cavally forest is a biodiversity hotspot under threat due to deforestation. C\xc3\xb4te d\xe2\x80\x99Ivoire has lost much of its forest cover over the past 60 years, caused in large part by smallholder agriculture. 
.
Our investment will finance efforts to end deforestation within the forest reserve and restore degraded forest. It will also support transition pathways for farmers currently producing in the reserve and promote regenerative agriculture for areas around the reserve. Click the link in our bio for more info.
.
.
.
#reforestation #climatechange"

b'In these difficult times, many of our business partners in the out-of-home and food service sector are facing serious challenges \xe2\x80\x93 especially the smaller, independently owned caf\xc3\xa9s, restaurants and bars. These businesses are part of the local fabric and the communities in which we live and work.\n.\nThrough our \xe2\x80\x9cAlways open for You\xe2\x80\x9d initiative, we\xe2\x80\x99re helping them ride out the storm and restart their businesses: We\xe2\x80\x99re extending payment terms, suspending rental fees for coffee machines and donating products \xe2\x80\x93 among other things. This initiative is worth an estimated CHF 500 million. Click the link in our bio to find out how we are responding to the COVID-19 crisis.'

b"Following on from our announcement of a plant-based :seedling: version of Milo in Australia, with this #FlashbackFriday let's take a moment to look back on how this iconic brand came to life. In 1934, Nestl\xc3\xa9 Australia food scientist Thomas Mayne developed a powdered chocolate :chocolate_bar: malt drink that could be mixed with water :potable_water: or milk :glass_of_milk: and drank hot :hot_springs_selector: or cold :snowflake_selector:. Launched at the Sydney Royal Easter Show that year, it's said that Thomas drank a cup of Milo every day until he died aged 93. Check out the link in our bio to learn more about the history of Nestl\xc3\xa9 :up_arrow_selector:. (Image: Nestl\xc3\xa9 Historical Archives)
.
.

b'Introducing the first baby :baby: food packaging designed for the future of recycling :recycling_symbol_selector:. A great example of @Gerber and @pilttipiiri implementing our commitment to make 100% of our packaging recyclable or reusable by 2025. The first-of-its-kind, single-material pouch for baby food will be available in the U.S. and Finland. \n#Recycling #Recyclable #ZeroWaste #Sustainability #CircularEconomy #Nestle #BabyFood #Gerber #Piltti'

b"We've recently announced the kick-off of a large-scale reforestation project. Benjamin Ware, Global Head Responsible Sourcing, outlines the approach taken by Nestl\xc3\xa9 as it ramps up its efforts to tackle climate change and boost biodiversity. More info in the bio :right_arrow_curving_up:
.
.
.
#climatechange #climateaction #climate #nature #biodiversity #environment"

b"We're stepping up our forest protection efforts as part of our broader plan to tackle #climatechange and boost #biodiversity. Our #reforestation program helps the planet and builds more climate-resilient communities. It wil help us achieve our pledge to be carbon-neutral by 2050
.
.
.
#climatechange #climateaction #climate #nature #biodiversity #environment"

b'Trees are one of our best allies in the fight against climate change \xe2\x80\x94 we are harnessing the power of forests to tackle climate change and restore biodiversity.  We are kicking off a major reforestation program with the planting of three million trees within our supply chains in the Americas \xe2\x80\x93  the first phase of a broader reforestation initiative. This brings us a step closer to fulfilling our pledge to be carbon neutral by 2050
.

The planting will occur on the farms where our raw materials are grown and harvested \xe2\x80\x93 making our supply chains more climate-friendly and climate-resilient in the long run. More info in the bio:right_arrow_curving_up_selector:
.
.
.

#climatechange #climateaction #climate #nature #biodiversity #environment'

b"We're going with the theme of coffee :hot_beverage: for this #FlashbackFriday! In 1938, our scientist, Max Morgenthaler, discovered a way to make instant coffee retain coffee's natural flavor. This resulted in Nescaf\xc3\xa9, a delicious cup of coffee by simply adding hot water :hot_springs_selector:. Today, @nescafe is enjoyed in over 180 countries :world_map_selector:! Check out the link in our bio to learn more about our history. (Image: Nestl\xc3\xa9 Historical Archives)
.
.
.
#Nescafe #Nestle #Coffee #History #Throwback"

.

b'Baristas and our consumers love a good coffee \xe2\x80\x93 and we do too. We have made coffee roasting, a critical process in coffee production, possible for baristas.
